description: Generic listing of all resources. Should not be used directly, instead use specific types such as Databanks and Studies
General information about this resource
Persistent identifier for this resource
Name of resource used in European projects
If different from above, name in the national language
Resource acronym
Link to the website or homepage of this resource
Short description of this resource
Keywords to increase findability of this resource. Try to use words that are not used in the description.
Group of individuals sharing a defining demographic characteristic
Contact e-mail address for this cohort
Listing who is/has been involved in the creation and maintenance of this resource
External identifier for this resource (e.g. EU PAS number, UMCG register number)
Type of resource, e.g. registry, cohort, biobank

The study design of this cohort, i.e. cross-sectional or longitudinal

A schematic depiction of the study design of this cohort
The data collection type of this cohort, i.e. retrospective or prospective; if both, select both

Geographical regions where data from this resource largely originate from

Year when last data was collected. Leave empty if collection is ongoing

Linkage options with additional data sources that are available for this resource

Definition of a data dictionary for a cohort, databank or datasource
Link to the resource of which contents has been released
version of the data dictionary, use semantic versioning (https://semver.org/)
tables part of this data dictionary
date of creation
notes specific to this data dictionary
Generic listing of all source variables. Should not be used directly, please use SourceVariables or RepeatedSourceVariables instead
data dictionary of the resource
table this variable is part of
name of the variable, unique within a table
in case of protocolised data collection this defines the moment in time this variable is collected on
Definition of a non-repeated variable, or of the first variable from a repeated range
string,int,decimal,date,datetime etc
unit ontology
to define foreign key relationships between variables within or across tables
whether this variable is required within this collection
to sort variables you can optionally add an order value
listing of all repeated variables defined for this variable
Any other information on this variable
Definition of a repeated sourceVariable. Refers to another variable for its definition.
reference to the definition of the sourceVariable that is being repeated
Definition of a table within a data dictionary
resource + data dictionary this table is defined for
unique table name in the data dictionary
short human readible description
defines what each record in this table describes
enables grouping of table list into topic and to display tables in a tree
description of the role/function of this table
count of the numbe of records in this table
list of mappings between this table and standard/harmonized tables
Mapping from collected tables to standard/harmonized tables, optionally including ETL syntaxes
data dictionary being mapped from, i.e. fromdata dictionary.resource + fromdata dictionary.version
name of the table being mapped from
model being mapped to, i.e. toModel.resource + toModel.version
name of the table being mapped to
Order in which table ETLs should be executed for this source-target combination
human readible description of the mapping
formal definition of the mapping, ideally executable code
Listing of categorical value+label definition in case of a categorical variable
e.g. PATO
reference to ontology term that defines this categorical value
Mappings from collected variables to standard/harmonized variables, optionally including ETL syntax.
Optional, source variable that was mapped from. You may also indicate that a mapping to a target variable was not done and leave this field empty (match = na)
optional, variable from other SourceTables. Initially one may only define mapping between releases

in UI this is then one lookup field. In Excel it will be two columns. Value of 'targetVariable' is filtered based on selected 'targetCollection' and together be used for fkey(collection,dataset,name) in Variable.
e.g. 'complete, partial, planned, no-match'
whether harmonisation is still draft or final
human readible description of the mapping
additional notes and comments
formal definition of the mapping, ideally executable code
